Why should we care: **Bio**: PhD student at the [chair of Operations, Economics and Strategy](https://www.epfl.ch/labs/oes/) at EPFL in Switzerland. Philipp’s current work focuses on leveraging data, optimization, and machine learning, to solve practical problems that matter to society.

Paper: [Computational Analysis of Bot Activity in the Asia-Pacific: A Comparative Study of Four National Elections ](https://ojs.aaai.org/index.php/ICWSM/article/view/18098)

Paper: [Predicting Opinion Dynamics via Sociologically-Informed Neural Networks](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2207.03990.pdf)
Why should we care: This paper presents an opinion dynamics model (i.e. predicting individuals opinions over time). They use a NN (which is socially informed) to predict opinions over time and show that regularisation by sociological opinion dynamics models converted to ODEs improves performance.

Paper: [On the Complexity of Opinions and Online Discussions](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.06807.pdf)
Why should we care: A method to (1) develop latent representations of online opinions using upvote/downvote data and (2) estimate the complexity (i.e. dimensionality) of the latent space.

Paper: [Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Hate Speech Detection Using a Data Augmentation Approach](https://ojs.aaai.org/index.php/ICWSM/article/view/19340/19112)
Why should we care: This paper presents some interesting tricks for domain adaptation in low resource hate speech datasets through data augmentation.
